roleset.name: destroy
roleset.note: DEVASTATE-V NOTES: Frames file for 'devastate' based on automatic expansion of 'destroy' Levin class (cl 44) and amuse-31.1 (emotional devastation). Verbnet predicts an instrumental subject. They also bring thedistinction between agent and instrument down to intentionality, whichwe've been trying to avoid. If you feel you can consistently makethat decision, go ahead; otherwise only use arg2 when there is also anarg0. (from devastate.01-v)
DEVASTATION-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on BOLT, devastate.01. Corresponds to VNcls destroy-44, amuse-31.1 (from devastation.01-n)

example.name: no instrument
example.text: Program traders argue that a reinstatement of the rule would devastate the ``pricing efficiency'' of the futures and stock markets.
example.arg: the ``pricing efficiency'' of the futures and stock markets

example.name: with instrument
example.text: Mary devastated John's fragile self-esteem with a single dirty look.

example.name: args 1 and 3
example.text: New York Times spins the economic devastation of the young as a "choice"

example.name: args 0 and 1
example.text: Its devastation of cities and towns along the eastern shoreline is extensive enough to be seen by satellite.
example.arg: of cities and towns along the eastern shoreline
